Available for Speaking

If your company or event could benefit from learning about cloud native things at the intersection of clouds, containers and microservices, drop me a line. See also this index of talks.

Date: Oct 26-27th, 2016
Event: All Things Open
Title: Characterizing and Contrasting Container Orchestrators
Abstract: Running a few containers? No problem. Running hundreds or thousands? Enter the container orchestrator. Let’s take a look at the characteristics of the four most popular container orchestrators and what makes them alike, yet unique.

Event: ContainerizeThis
Title: From Engines to Orchestrators
Links: 1
Abstract: An introduction to container runtimes (engines) and an understanding of when container orchestrators enter and what role they play. We’ll look at what makes them alike, yet unique.

Date: Sept. 8th, 2016
Event: Nginx Conference (1)
Title: Powering Microservices & Sockets with Nginx
Abstract: Microservices present challenges of coordination, SSL termination and socket connection among others. Looking to different cloud providers to assist with their load-balancers leaves you wanting as features socket connection support, SSL termination and geo-distributed load-balancing are often absent.

Date: Aug 22-24th, 2016
Event: LinuxCon (1)
Title: Characterizing and Contrasting Container Orchestrators
Abstract: Running a few containers? No problem. Running hundreds or thousands? Enter the container orchestrator. Let’s take a look at the characteristics of the four most popular container orchestrators and what makes them alike, yet unique.

Date: July 27, 2016
Event: Rackspace Tech Talk
Title: Overlay/Underlay: An Over/Under Bet on Container Networking
Abstract: An inherent to component to any distributed application, networking is one of the most complicated and expansive infrastructure technologies.

Container networking needs to be developer-friendly and application-driven. With developers busily adopting container technologies, the time has come for network engineers and operators to prepare for the unique challenges brought on by cloud native applications.
